Reconnect with Your Roots

Embark on a transformative journey with sacred plant medicines and ancestral traditions in the heart of Bulgaria's mystical Rose Valley.

Explore Our Retreats

Our Sacred Commitment

We are a dedicated family of healers, musicians, and guides united by a profound respect for ancestral traditions and the sacred medicines that connect us to spirit.

Mission & Values

Our mission is to create a safe, supportive, and sacred space for deep healing and spiritual exploration. We honor the indigenous lineages from which these practices originate, particularly the Shuar tradition, and are committed to preserving their integrity and wisdom.

  • Authenticity: Upholding the traditional practices and teachings with utmost respect.
  • Safety: Ensuring the physical, emotional, and spiritual well-being of all participants.
  • Integration: Providing tools and support to help you carry the lessons of your journey into your daily life.

Our Community

The Sacred Medicines

Honoring the traditions and spiritual context of each plant ally.

Kambô: The Fire of Transformation

Originating from the Amazon jungle, Kambô is a powerful medicine that cleanses on all levels. It is not a psychedelic but a deep physical and energetic purgative that strengthens the immune system, clears 'panema' (bad luck or negative energy), and brings clarity and stamina.

Preparation (Dieta):

  • Fast for at least 8 hours before the ceremony.
  • Avoid alcohol and recreational drugs for 3 days prior.
  • Stay hydrated, but do not drink water 2 hours before application.

Tabaco & Rapé: The Spirit's Breath

Sacred Tobacco (Mapacho) is a fundamental plant in many indigenous traditions, used for cleansing, prayer, and protection. Rapé, a fine powder made from this tobacco and other medicinal plants, is blown into the nostrils to clear the mind and energy channels, centering the self and connecting to higher consciousness.

Guidelines for Respect:

  • Approach with a clear intention and prayer.
  • Receive with humility and an open heart.
  • Understand this is medicine, not a recreational substance.

Our Medicine Retreats

A profound journey of healing, purification, and connection, guided by sacred plant medicines and ancient rituals.

Kambô

The sacred frog secretion for deep physical and energetic cleansing. We honor its Amazonian origins, applying it with intention and care to purify the body and strengthen the spirit.

Rapé

A sacred shamanic snuff from the Amazon, used to clear the mind, open the third eye, and ground the spirit. Served with deep respect for its traditional use in prayer and meditation.

Tabaco

A grounding master plant, used ceremonially to cleanse, protect, and carry our prayers. Its ritualistic importance lies in its power to connect us to the earth and the present moment.

Vision Quest

A sacred ceremony of seeking vision, guidance, and connection with the spirit world through solitude, prayer, and communion with nature.

What's Included in Your Retreat

Inipi Ceremony (Sweat Lodge)

A powerful purification ritual for prayer and rebirth. We provide cultural background and guidance on preparation. Please bring a towel and appropriate attire (sarong/shorts).

Integrational Workshops

Group sessions focused on sharing, understanding, and integrating the experiences from the ceremonies, fostering a strong sense of community.

Full Support

Translation between English and Spanish is provided. We also facilitate pre-retreat online connections to build community before we even meet.

Ceremonial Tools

Kuripes & Tepis

Sacred pipes for administering Rapé. High-quality, ethically sourced shamanic tools available for purchase during the retreat.

Ceremonial Drum

The voice of the Great Spirit. Used to move energy, induce trance states, and call in protective spirits.

Chakapa

A rattle made of bundled leaves, used to cleanse a person's energetic field with rhythmic sound.

The Rose Valley, Bulgaria

Our retreats are held in the spiritually potent Rose Valley, a land rich with history and natural power. Surrounded by ancient Thracian tombs and vibrant nature, the site itself is a potent ally in our healing work, offering a profound sense of peace and connection to the earth.

How to Get Here

We are located near Kazanlak. Detailed travel logistics, including bus/train schedules from major cities like Sofia and Plovdiv, will be provided upon booking. We can also assist with arranging local transfers.

The Heartbeat of the Ceremony

Medicine music guides the journey, carrying our prayers and weaving the fabric of the sacred space.

Icaros: Songs of the Plants

These are sacred songs taught directly by the plant spirits. Each icaro carries a specific energy for healing, protection, or calling in allies. Their melodies are the sonic signature of the medicine.

Heartbeat Drum Songs

The steady rhythm of the drum grounds us, connects us to the heartbeat of the Earth, and can guide us through intense parts of the journey. These songs are prayers for strength and courage.

Frequently Asked Questions

Find answers to common questions about our retreats.

What should I expect during a Kambô ceremony? +

Kambô is a powerful cleansing medicine that works primarily on the physical and energetic body. During the ceremony, small points are burned on the skin and the frog secretion is applied. You may experience nausea, purging, increased heart rate, and a feeling of heat. This process typically lasts 15-45 minutes and is followed by a deep sense of clarity and well-being.

Why is the dieta important? +

The dieta is a crucial part of the preparation. It involves abstaining from certain foods (like red meat, pork, spicy food, salt, sugar, and fermented foods) and activities to purify your body and mind. This allows the medicines to work more deeply and effectively, and shows your respect and commitment to the process.

How do you ensure safety during ceremonies? +

Your safety is our highest priority. Our facilitators are highly experienced and have trained for years with these medicines. We conduct thorough health screenings beforehand to ensure our retreats are suitable for you. We maintain a high facilitator-to-participant ratio to provide individual attention and support throughout the ceremonies.

Kuripes & Tepis: Sacred Pipes

What are Kuripes & Tepis?

Kuripes and Tepis are sacred shamanic tools used in traditional Rapé ceremonies. These beautifully crafted pipes serve as the vessel through which the sacred tobacco medicine is administered.

Kuripe (Self-Administration)

A V-shaped pipe used for self-administering Rapé. One end goes into the nostril, while the other end is blown into by the user. This allows for personal communion with the medicine.

Tepi (Serving Others)

A straight pipe used by a practitioner to serve Rapé to another person. This creates a sacred exchange and allows for guided administration of the medicine.

Sacred Craftsmanship

Our pipes are ethically sourced and handcrafted by indigenous artisans, made from sustainable bamboo, bone, or wood. Each piece carries the intention and blessing of its creator.

Available for Purchase

High-quality Kuripes and Tepis are available for purchase during our retreats, allowing you to take home a sacred tool for your continued practice.
